Kohn-Luttinger superconductivity is a theoretical model of unconventional superconductivity proposed by Walter Kohn and John Luttinger in 1964.
It suggests that superconductivity can arise from the exchange of spin fluctuations between electrons, or more specifically, with Fermi liquid theory.
